text: Light up an LED for the first time
description: Learn the basics of connecting an LED and powering it to emit light.

text: Learn to use wire strippers
description: Master the skill of stripping insulation from wires safely and effectively.

text: Complete an electronics kit
description: Build confidence by assembling a beginner-friendly electronics kit.

text: Learn to Solder
description: Develop the essential skill of soldering components onto circuit boards.

text: Learn to use a breadboard
description: Understand how to use a breadboard to prototype and test circuits.

text: Get a circuit wrong and try again
description: Embrace learning by troubleshooting and fixing a non-functional circuit.

text: Learn Ohm’s Law
description: Understand the relationship between voltage, current, and resistance.

text: Fix something that’s broken
description: Apply your skills to repair a simple electronic device.

text: Measure voltage with a multimeter
description: Learn how to use a multimeter to measure voltage in a circuit.

text: Learn to read a schematic
description: Understand the symbols and layout of electronic circuit diagrams.

text: Learn to read a datasheet
description: Discover how to interpret the specifications and capabilities of components.

text: Learn to control the brightness of an LED
description: Experiment with resistors or PWM to adjust LED brightness.

text: Learn to desolder a through-hole component
description: Master the technique of safely removing soldered components from a PCB.

text: Make something that makes noise
description: Create a circuit that generates sound, such as a buzzer or simple tone.

text: Turn a breadboard circuit into a schematic
description: Translate your prototype into a professional-looking circuit diagram.

text: Measure current with a multimeter
description: Learn how to measure the flow of current in a circuit using a multimeter.

text: Make a voltage divider to lower the voltage for a project
description: Design and implement a voltage divider circuit for your needs.

text: Turn something on using a sensor
description: Use a sensor to trigger or control another device in a circuit.

text: Use a diode to protect your circuit from reverse voltages
description: Learn how to prevent damage to your circuit using a diode.

text: Make an oscillator that makes noise
description: Build a simple oscillator circuit that generates an audible tone.

text: Use a relay to switch something on at a higher voltage
description: Control high-voltage devices using a low-voltage relay circuit.

text: Make a capacitor rocket (too much voltage)
description: Experiment with capacitors and observe their behavior under high voltage.

text: Learn to solder surface-mount parts
description: Practice the advanced skill of soldering tiny surface-mounted components.

text: Use a 555 timer in a circuit
description: Integrate a versatile 555 timer IC into your project for timing applications.

text: Make a sound louder with an amplifier
description: Design a simple amplifier circuit to boost audio signals.

text: Use addressable RGB LEDs in a project
description: Add vibrant, customizable lighting to your projects with addressable LEDs.

text: Make a project with a Raspberry Pi
description: Create a project using the versatile Raspberry Pi for various applications like automation, home security, and more.

text: Let the smoke out accidentally
description: A term used in electronics to describe the moment when a component fails, often releasing smoke and causing permanent damage.

text: Use fritzing or TinkerCAD to create a circuit diagram
description: Use tools like Fritzing or TinkerCAD to design circuit diagrams, which help visualize and plan electronics projects.

text: Make something with Arduino
description: Build a project with an Arduino board, a popular microcontroller platform for creating interactive devices.

text: Let the smoke out of an Arduino accidentally
description: The unfortunate event when an Arduino board is damaged due to incorrect connections or overheating, releasing smoke.

text: Measure frequency with a multimeter
description: Use a multimeter to measure the frequency of an electrical signal, a useful tool in troubleshooting circuits.

text: Use an Op-Amp in a circuit
description: Incorporate an operational amplifier (Op-Amp) in your circuit designs to amplify signals and control various parameters.

text: Use a crowbar circuit to protect against over voltage
description: Design and implement a crowbar circuit to protect sensitive electronics from voltage spikes or surges.

text: Use a surge diode to protect a circuit
description: Integrate surge diodes in your circuit to prevent damage from sudden voltage spikes by directing excess current away from sensitive components.

text: Make something for a friend
description: Design and build a personalized electronics project as a gift for a friend, adding a creative and thoughtful touch.

text: Make a motor controller with a H Bridge
description: Use an H-Bridge circuit to control the direction and speed of motors in robotics or other automated projects.

text: Make a counter with logic gates
description: Create a digital counter using logic gates, a fundamental project in learning digital electronics and binary operations.

text: Apply solder paste to a PCB with a stencil
description: Use solder paste and a stencil to apply a precise amount of paste to a printed circuit board (PCB) before soldering components.

text: Teach a friend an electronics skill
description: Share your knowledge by teaching a friend a useful electronics skill, such as soldering, circuit design, or microcontroller programming.

text: Make something with a 7 segment display
description: Design and build a project using a 7-segment display to show numbers or letters in various applications like clocks or counters.

text: Measure voltage with an oscilloscope
description: Use an oscilloscope to measure and visualize voltage changes over time in your circuits, ideal for debugging and signal analysis.

text: Measure capacitor equivalent series resistance
description: Use specialized tools to measure the equivalent series resistance (ESR) of a capacitor, crucial for assessing its health and performance.

text: Make an Internet of Things (IoT) project
description: Build an IoT project that connects devices to the internet, enabling remote monitoring, automation, and data collection.

text: Make something with solar panels
description: Design and create a project powered by solar panels, a sustainable solution for low-energy applications like garden lights or small devices.

text: Look at an audio input on an oscilloscope
description: Use an oscilloscope to visualize audio signals, helping analyze waveforms and troubleshoot audio circuits.

text: Make a regulated power supply
description: Design and build a power supply that maintains a constant output voltage despite fluctuations in input or load.

text: Use a MOSFET instead of a relay in a project
description: Replace a mechanical relay with a MOSFET for faster switching and improved reliability in your projects.

text: Make your own USB cable
description: Create a custom USB cable tailored to your specific needs, such as unique lengths or connector types.

text: Use an LED matrix in a project
description: Incorporate an LED matrix into your project to display patterns, animations, or text in a dynamic way.

text: Filter unwanted noise from a signal
description: Use filters to remove electrical noise from signals, improving the clarity and accuracy of your circuits.

text: Use a frequency analyzer for a project
description: Employ a frequency analyzer to study and optimize the frequency components of signals in your electronics project.

text: Order a PCB with your design
description: Turn your circuit design into a professional PCB by sending it to a manufacturing service for production.

text: Repair a broken trace on a PCB
description: Fix a damaged PCB trace using techniques like soldering a jumper wire or applying conductive ink.

text: Use automatic gain control
description: Implement automatic gain control (AGC) in your circuit to maintain a consistent signal amplitude despite variations in input.

text: Make a PID circuit with Op-Amps
description: Build a Proportional-Integral-Derivative (PID) controller using Op-Amps for precise control in systems like robotics.

text: Teach a class on Electronics
description: Share your expertise by teaching a group the fundamentals of electronics, inspiring others to explore the field.

text: Learn PCB Design Software
description: Master PCB design software like Eagle, KiCad, or Altium to create professional-grade circuit boards.

text: Use an e-paper display in a project
description: Incorporate an e-paper display into your project for low-power, high-contrast text or graphics, ideal for portable devices.

text: Build a Radio Frequency (RF) Project
description: Design and construct a project that uses RF technology, such as wireless communication systems or remote controls.

text: Make an open source project
description: Develop a project and share it openly with the community, allowing others to learn from and improve upon your work.

text: Use capacitive touch in a PCB design
description: Incorporate capacitive touch technology into your PCB design for sleek, buttonless user interfaces.

text: Make something with PCB Art
description: Create a visually striking PCB design, blending functionality with artistic elements to produce a unique project.

text: Make an electronic sculpture
description: Combine electronics and creativity to design a sculpture that integrates lights, motors, or interactive elements.

text: Make a switch mode power supply
description: Design a switch mode power supply (SMPS) for efficient power conversion and regulation in electronic devices.

text: Release a tutorial on a project you've made
description: Share your knowledge by creating a tutorial to guide others in replicating or learning from your project.

text: Create an FPGA Project
description: Develop a project using a Field-Programmable Gate Array (FPGA) for high-speed and flexible digital logic design.

text: Write your own C/C++ library for a sensor from scratch
description: Challenge yourself by coding a custom C/C++ library to interface with a sensor, optimizing for your specific application.
